subject: Re: [junit] junit reports
msgSnippet: Balraj, Current versions of MS-Word can open a typical HTML document. Is that sufficient for you?  If not, perhaps a little bit of the reasoning behind the
messageBody:
Balraj,

Current versions of MS-Word can open a typical HTML document.

Is that sufficient for you? If not, perhaps a little bit of the reasoning
behind the request. (I've found that this answer tends to satisfy most
people that ask for a Word version of a resume that they found in HTML
format -- the smarter ones don't need to ask.)

-Rob

At 10/6/2005 11:08 AM, you wrote:
>Balraj,
>
>Outside of JUnit is probably your best bet. Googling "HTML to Word"
>gave me some promising links.
>
> David Saff
>
>Balraj Goulikar wrote:
>
> > How to get JUnit reports in a word doc? There are html reports produced
> > using the foll:
> > <target name="testresults" description="Produce a web report of the test
> > results (see unittest )"
> > depends="unittests">
> > <junitreport todir="${reports.webpages}">
> > <fileset dir="${reports.junit}">
> > <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> > </fileset>
> > <report format="frames" todir="${reports.webpages}"/>
> > </junitreport>
> > <echo>Your test results are in the directoty "${reports.junit}"</echo>
> > </target>
> >
> > is there a way to get them as word document reports?
> >
> > Thanks in advance,
> >
> > Balraj
>

Rob Biedenharn <Rob_Biedenharn@...>
(C) 513-295-4739
(H) 513-677-2172 http://alum.mit.edu/www/rob_biedenharn/
